pros: Great benefits. Fair wages. Working from home. Excellent team. Positive workplace. Motivating upper management.
cons: No cons at this time.

review_title: Founder's Dictator-like Leadership: A Suffocating Work Environment
job_title: Administrative Assistant in Arlington Heights, IL
pros: I had a less-than-ideal relationship with the founder, but I can't argue that the company offered competitive pay. They were able t show their dedication to luring in and keeping top talent.
cons: It is truly disheartening to acknowledge that I endured such a horrid experience for an extended period. The founder's oppressive leadership style created an environment that was filthy with tension, fear, and a lack of respect. It feltas though employees were merely pawns in a game, constantly subjected to the founder's whims and desires without any consideration for our well-being or professional growth. The founder's dictorial appriach stifled creativity and innovation, fostering an atmosphere of conformity rather than fostering the potential within each individual.

review_title: Incapable leadership and terrible office politics
pros: There are a lot of well intentioned and dedicated employees. However, the level of incompetence is high and office politics ruin any meaningful progress.
cons: Senior management incompetence, rife with bureaucracy and politics. No upward mobility. Incompetence is rewarded

review_title: AGGRESIVELY focused on having fame and has an AWFUL CONSCIENCE!
job_title: Grant Program Assistant in Arlington Heights, IL
pros: I didn't expect too much from the pay, but there were no benefits that I could actually benefit as well! I should've avoided this entirely!
cons: This organization was AGGRESIVELY focused on having fame and being a money making business! They take so much money but pay employees terribly! The management surely has an AWFUL CONSCIENCE to be able to do this without remorse!

review_title: The daily harassment was terribly BRUTAL!
job_title: Administrative Assistant in Arlington Heights, IL
pros: I can't believe I actually survived and didn't drown from all the workload and complaints I get everyday!
cons: The responsibilities were too much and the daily harassment was terribly BRUTAL! I was plagued with complaints from members everyday and it was EXTREMELY stressful and toxic! Management doesn't provide even the smallest support and we're basically swimming on our own!

job_title: Senior Graphic Designer in Arlington Heights, IL
pros: Variety of projects initially and pay was decent for an association
cons: Toxic from legacy leadership down. At least one person seemed to be fired every week. Cycle of firing and hiring entire marketing/creative departments every few years.

pros: Benefits and wfh since covid
cons: Unprofessional HR and misogynistic atmosphere

review_title: Good benefits and staff; poor planning and management
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Arlington Heights, IL
pros: Good benefits (insurance, vacation time, 401k); staff are asked to juggle a lot and many rise to the occasion.
cons:
Initiatives are not well planned, and at times it feels like staff are set up to fail (for example, a large managed organization that was seemingly onboarded before understanding the resource requirements... or any real detailed requirements for that matter).

One department recently had what amounted to a mass exodus, in large part due to a culture of saying "yes" far too often, and expecting more and more from the same already strapped and burnt-out workforce. I feel deeply for this group, since they work incredibly hard, and deserve much better.

pros: Good employee ethic at the practice
cons: Not enough pay for the job

cons: No work from home opportunity & little schedule flexibility

cons: Very out of touch upper management

review_title: The Worst Place I Have Ever Worked
job_title: Worked In Administration in Arlington Heights, IL
pros: The long term retirement plan.
cons: ASPS is FILLED with office politics. High level people stab other in the back, just to side with the members who hold leadership positions. Accomplishments mean nothing if a member holding a leadership position wants to get rid of you because you speak the truth and want to do what is best for the organization. Fickle leaders who get rid of anyone who challenges them. People are promoted without any qualifications other than they have been there many years. I wouldn't recommend this employer to my worst enemy.

job_title: Project Manager in Arlington Heights, IL
pros: Benefits, Flexibility, Tuition Reimbursement, Professional Development Workshops, Employee Engagement... the list goes on.
cons: No cons at this time.

job_title: Middle Management in Arlington Heights, IL
pros: Nothing. Truly nothing. Colleagues are nice and very hard working. Director level and above are horrible.
cons: High expectations, little direction and lots of the blame game. Director and above get raises and very substantial bonuses. Below that, cost of living only. Bonus? Laughable.

pros: Great place to work and learn
cons: I have no cons to this post.

pros: Benefits and time off are solid.
cons: Separate departments, little teamwork offered

review_title: Very little training and not very good management.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Arlington Heights, IL
pros: Great benefits and great people to work with. Even some of the management.
cons: Policies not equal for all employees. Some non-exempt (overtime paid) are able to work at home when needed and receive overtime pay, while others are not. Those that are not are told that it is against company policy. Offered ideas to help for workload and then when employee asks is given very little and not given the help offered. Workloads are very high and can be enough for 2-3 people, but 1 person is expected to get all done in the 37.5 hour work week. Very little training.

pros: Location, work/life balance, relaxed work pace
cons: Pathologically political environment that you may not detect at first, but it will become apparent when trying to be a good team player will only waste your time at no valuable gains. Management is made up of less than qualified personnel who either lack credentials or being naturally simple-minded and indolent makes them anxious and vicious enough that they will play any dirty trick to protect their positions. As a result, there is no training and guidance, and you are left to your own devices to figure out what do to. Handing out insignificant projects is not only a habit, but a strategy to keep you from learning and accomplishing valuable tasks where you can stand out. This is not the place for driven and talented people. One needs to be ordinary and of an average intellect, and being gossipy will give you leverage, and win you some friends.  Do not underestimate the power of gossip if you find yourself working here. It is the natural result when a business is made up and run by second-rate employees that in the absence of original and creative ideas to push the organization forward, devotee their time in devising ways to tear down competition.

review_title: A Company on Its Way Up
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Arlington Heights, IL
pros:
Increasing cross-department communication
Friendly, dedicated and passionate coworkers
Ability to bring new ideas and be heard
Can make a real impact for patients and practitioners 
Great benefits - healthcare, tuition reimbursement, telecommuting, wellness fund, relaxation room for those times when you have a headache or just "need a minute", and even free tampons in the ladies room!
cons:
A lot of work to do! More quality staff is needed to continue progress on major initiatives
Work/life balance is getting better, but still room to grow
Looking forward to more infrastructure investments to help processes run more efficiently

review_title: Good place for comfortable job, not for go getters
pros: Competitive salary and excellent benefits compared to corporations. 35+ hour work week except for annual meeting time. Good IT support and systems. Within department, employees are friendly.
cons: No chance for upward advancement; always hires management from outside. Limited / discouraged tuition, seminar, association reimbursement. Many silos within the organization (not a lot of information sharing) resulting from competitivenes and ineffectiveness in top management. Can put as much time and effort in as you please - competence and time management is expected but excellence is not expected or rewarded..

pros: Nothing you can’t find at any other association or employer. The benefits are decent.
cons: Horrible work culture/environment. Staff VPs excel at only one thing: the blame game.  The unspoken rule is shut your mouth and do your job (and your boss’s) or you’ll be the next one forced out the door.  They have no interest in improving their culture, only hiding and covering up their egregious and continuous  errors from the members.  Those who engage in these activities and don’t complain about the ethical implications are the only ones promoted. New hires are not  trained. Each man for himself mentality. Overall negative environment with such a high turnover rate they usually won’t post it.  HR is only in place to protect the staff VPs and retribution is a regular thing.

review_title: No guidance or direction, but held accountable...to what??
pros: Some kind hearted coworkers. Great pay.
cons: Lack of communication. No guidance or support to perform your job successfully. Training was non existent. Pass the buck is cultural norm. Despite no clearly defined expectations, you are expected to set priorities and fulfill elusive business needs.

job_title: Education Manager in Arlington Heights, IL
pros: Large organization, decent benefits, has flex time
cons: Management not sure of their direction. Although member association, members tend to be too involved in the day to day operations. Causing confusion with staff.

review_title: Great Association. Excellent place to work
pros: I have worked at ASPS for a couple of years. Solid leadership, very employee focused. Strong benefits. Senior management is supportive of good ideas and interested in trying new ideas.
cons: This is an association designed to support members. Sometimes directions shift to accommodate the m Myers.
